description: Erection of single storey rear extension (4.00m in depth, maximum height of 3.78m and eaves height of 3.00m)
decision_conditions: The proposed extension would extend beyond a wall forming a side elevation of the original dwellinghouse and would have a width greater than half the width of the original dwellinghouse, in conflict with Paragraph A.1 (j) (iii) of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

The applicant has made no reference to the proposed materials on the application form or plans so officers are unable to confirm compliance with Class A.3 (a) which states; "the materials used in any exterior work (other than materials used in the construction of a conservatory) must be of a similar appearance to those used in the construction of the exterior of the existing dwellinghouse"

Please revise the Ordnance Survey based location plan to show the red outline in the proposed site including the front pavement, where drop kerb will be proposed.  The site location plan needs to be in scale 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red, showing at least two road frontages and a North point.
